intro: Chrysoma laricifolia, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is a hardy shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
